item.title: Dissertation
item.description: Title: Investigating the effectiveness of major Internet protocols in addressing DNS privacy concerns. In this paper I investigate a recent and ongoing problem of DNS privacy. The paper covers in depth analysis of the current issue with DNS privacy, why it is a problem and what the community has proposed to address this issue. As the investigation progresses I explain the underlying technologies that the proposed solutions contain and critically analyse and compare their performances using established machine learning methods.

item.title: Dethroning TCP in the Web
item.description: prerequisites The reader should have some understanding of basic networking concepts such as the OSI protocol layers, how the web and in particular HTTP works. Abstract Ever since Tim Burners-Lee created the World Wide Web, TCP has been the main and in most cases the only option providing reliable transport to web exchanges. Understandably, TCP was the obvious option since web exchanges required reliability to exchange web content. However as HTTP continued to evolve throughout the years to fit the needs of the evolving web, TCP’s limitations became more evident.

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m Ahmed Al-Jabri, a recent BSc graduate from Aston University for Cybersecurity. My areas of interest mainly contain Computer Systems and Networking, Distributed Systems and Secure Programming.In this site I will be sharing technical blogs and write-ups on various topics of interest. You can reach me by email at: contact@ahmedaljabri.site
